$SOL already completed a clean liquidity sweep down to the 123 zone, which acted as strong demand on both the intraday and higher timeframe charts. The reaction was immediate and aggressive, showing buyers are still active at these levels.
On the daily chart, SOL is still trading inside a major accumulation range, not breaking structure. The recent drop was corrective, not impulsive. On the lower timeframe, price reclaimed the short-term range and is now holding above demand instead of rolling over, which reduces short probability.
Shorting here would mean fading demand after a successful defense ‚Äî that‚Äôs low reward. The higher-probability play is to look for continuation toward the range highs.

Support Zones
‚Ä¢ 124.0 ‚Äì 123.0 (strong intraday demand)
‚Ä¢ 120.0 ‚Äì 118.5 (HTF defense zone)
Resistance Zones
‚Ä¢ 128.5 ‚Äì 130.0 (local supply)
‚Ä¢ 135.0 ‚Äì 140.0 (major range resistance)

As long as $SOL holds above 123, upside continuation remains favored. Take partial profits early, trail after TP1, and don‚Äôt overleverage.
And as always ‚Äî if you‚Äôre not following Token Talk, you‚Äôre missing these $SOL setups before momentum hits.

$SOL broke out from a massive reaccumulation range, and now retests it.
Hold here, and price discovery awaits.

$SOL  TL;DR ‚Üí Markets don‚Äôt bottom on hype ‚Äî they bottom when leverage resets, structure stabilizes, and price refuses to break. ‚Üí Solana is showing exactly that behavior. üß© WHAT A REAL START LOOKS LIKE (6-SIGNAL FRAMEWORK) ‚Üí You don‚Äôt need all six ‚Äî but when 4 out of 6 align, probabilities shift. ‚úÖ 1) Price structure (base condition) ‚Üí SOL holding $124‚Äì126 for multiple sessions ‚Üí No new lower low vs recent dip (~‚àí30% from local high) ‚Üí Daily volatility contracting (ATR ‚Üì) ‚Üí Sellers are being absorbed, not accelerating ‚úÖ 2) Open Interest behavior ‚Üí Aggregated SOL OI ‚âà $6.9B ‚Üí 24h change: flat to +0.5‚Äì1%, while price is sideways ‚Üí No sharp OI flush on dips ‚Üí Leverage is building without price stress (classic pre-move behavior) ‚úÖ 3) Funding rates ‚Üí OI-weighted funding: ~0% to +0.01% ‚Üí Binance / Bybit funding oscillating around neutral ‚Üí No sustained positive funding trend ‚Üí No overcrowded longs, no leverage excess ‚òëÔ∏è 4) Liquidation skew ‚Üí Upside scenario: ~$1.06B shorts liquidated at +15% ‚Üí Downside scenario: ~$474M longs liquidated at ‚àí15% ‚Üí Liquidation clusters heavier above price than below ‚Üí Max pain remains to the upside ‚òëÔ∏è 5) Volume profile ‚Üí Futures volume: ~$10‚Äì11B (24h) ‚Üí Spot volume: ~$700‚Äì800M (24h) ‚Üí No volume spike, no panic prints ‚Üí Participation without urgency = positioning phase ‚òëÔ∏è 6) Market regime / sentiment ‚Üí Fear & Greed Index: ~29 (Fear) ‚Üí Long/Short ratio (accounts): ~3.1‚Äì3.5 long-heavy ‚Üí Position ratio: ~2.0, not extreme ‚Üí Sentiment weak, structure holding ‚û°Ô∏è 4‚Äì5 out of 6 conditions are already active. üõë WHAT DOES NOT MOVE PRICE (IMPORTANT)  ‚ùå ETF headlines ‚ùå Influencer bullish calls ‚ùå ‚ÄúGood news‚Äù narratives ‚ùå Sudden +10% green candles ‚ùå Funding spikes above +0.05%  These appear after positioning is done ‚Äî not before it.

Back in October, I covered x402's planned rewrite and urged tempering excitement until V2 truly matured the design.

x402 V2 is now live and production-ready, resolving the original's headaches while unlocking its full potential ‚Äî especially for developers who weathered the friction but saw the vision most clearly.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the key upgrades in V2.üëá

~~ Analysis by @davewardonline ~~

At its core, I'd break these down into three developments:

‚û¢ The standardization of payment formats
‚û¢ The creation of a standard extension format for plug-ins
‚û¢ Added support for wallet-based access and reusable sessions

Here's what I mean by this:

The Standardization of Payment Formats

Unlike V1, which required repeated protocol-level updates to support new chains, V2 standardizes how payments are represented at a fundamental level, making x402 multi-chain by default.

This means it works across Ethereum L2s and Solana without special-case code, and supports stablecoins, tokens, and even traditional payment rails like ACH, SEPA, or credit cards using the same underlying structure. Payment routing is also more dynamic in V2, so the destination of a payment can change per request. That enables revenue sharing, shared APIs, and dynamic pricing without changing the API itself.

A Standard Extension Format for Plug-ins

Previously, extending @coinbase's x402 often meant updating the core protocol or SDK, a tedious and unrealistic condition.

In V2, those changes move out of the core and into standardized extensions. The protocol now supports and expects plugins, so new functionality can be added as optional extensions without requiring a system-wide upgrade. This also enables automatic discovery: services can publish machine-readable metadata that describes their paid APIs (what they do, what they cost, and what payment options they accept), and facilitators can ingest that data into an API-first directory that agents and SDKs can query. The core stays stable while features evolve at the edges, and the SDK can dynamically select chains, assets, and facilitators based on simple developer preferences.

Wallet-Based Access and Reusable Sessions

The third major change is wallet-based access and reusable sessions, which brings x402 in line with how access works on the modern internet.

In V1, every API call required completing the full payment flow, which effectively enforced a pure per-request micropayment model. That's not how most users or agents expect systems to work today, where subscriptions and session-based access dominate. V2 preserves the balance-based model while enabling reusable access after purchase, cutting latency and avoiding repeated onchain calls. This makes subscriptions, sessions, and repeated access patterns possible for both humans and agents.

What the Data Actually Shows

So the protocol has improved. But is anyone actually using it? Given the continued "all time highs" of transaction volumes advertised in posts, you'd think yes. And to an extent, you'd be right. But as with many network metrics in our industry, they need to be sterilized once gamed or meme-related volume has been removed.

In the case of x402, @OnchainLu of onchain data provider @artemis believes this illegitimate activity accounts for 47% of all x402 transactions to date, mostly from teams gaming leaderboards to climb x402scan rankings.

That sounds damning, but it represents only 14% of total dollar volume, and gamed activity correlates strongly with legitimate transaction activity. Some of it is also just teams testing infrastructure. As projects move from testing to production, these percentages should decline.

Where Real Usage Lives

For the 53% of transactions that Artemis classifies as legitimate, those come from servers offering high-frequency, low-cost services where micropayments make sense. Artemis highlights AISA, @x402secure , LucyOS, @AgentLISA_ai, and @heurist_ai as exemplars, processing millions of micropayments with near-zero artificial activity. While in October and November the vast majority occurred on @base (86% of transactions and 89% of volume), in December activity's migrated to @solana which processes ~36% of transactions and ~72% of volume, largely from agent-to-agent services.

Looking Forward

Overall, sift through the "spam" transactions and you'll see a lot's going right for x402.

What's still to come is verifying the legitimacy of agents and services, which ERC-8004 will help with but still remains in its early stages, as well as service providers adopting x402.

We'll probably overestimate how fast agentic commerce takes off in the short term, but do the opposite for its growth in the long term.

In the meantime, if you're a builder, tinker around with V2, share what you make in the x402 builders chat. If you're an investor keep a level head about the technology. If x402 memes are your thing, there's no shame in that but if you're looking for a long-term bet it's best to hold off as the technology itself has some proving to do.

#SOL

2025 was a defining year for 1inch.

We pushed liquidity forward, expanded cross-chain infrastructure, refreshed our identity as DeFi matures, and kept scaling the ecosystem around our products. 
You‚Äôve probably noticed ‚Äî 1inch looks a bit different. 
In October, we launched our new visual identity. As we bring more of the world onchain, we‚Äôre doubling down on what matters: simple, reliable infrastructure that lets users and partners build the future of finance their own way.

And yes ‚Äî the unicorn‚Äôs still there. Just like our original hackathon spirit.
Let‚Äôs start with 1inch Aqua: the shared liquidity layer that transforms DeFi capital utilization.

Aqua lets users deploy liquidity across multiple strategies at the same time, keeping funds in their wallet. Developer release shipped in November, full release comes in 2026. 
The biggest integration milestone: @solana support.

We built the first trustless cross-chain swaps between Solana and EVM networks ‚Äî so users can access Solana tokens across 1inch products and move assets safely between ecosystems. 
Interoperability also expanded on EVM: we integrated @LineaBuild, @SonicLabs, and @unichain.

At the same time, we kept building partnerships across DeFi and beyond - including @Ledger, @iSafePal, @coinbase, @BarterDeFi, @HashportNetwork, @InnerworksID, @flowdesk_co, and @RangoExchange.
Builders stayed at the center.

Together with @ETHGlobal, we launched the Unite DeFi online hackathon: 1,120 hackers, $525,000 in bounties - and projects shipping fast. 
Offline mattered too.

In 2025 we showed up across five continents - from Davos to @ETHGlobal Taipei, from TOKEN2049 to DevConnect Argentina, plus our own Unite DeFi conference alongside TOKEN2049. 
And the core kept running at scale: 115 million swaps powered in 2025.

You can find all the details here: 

https://blog.1inch.com/1inch-in-2025/

Thanks for sharing an amazing year with us.

In 2026, we move forward as 1‚Äù
eventually all pairs will be more liquid and tradeable on Solana than any other market on earth
